Type.Name: Drag
Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Drop (Gdk.DragContext context, uint time_);

Docs.param: a
the timestamp for this operation.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool Motion (Gdk.DragContext context, Gdk.Window dest_window, Gdk.DragProtocol protocol, int x_root, int y_root, Gdk.DragAction suggested_action, Gdk.DragAction possible_actions, uint time_);

Docs.summary: Updates the drag context when the pointer moves or the set of actions changes.
Docs.param: a
the new destination window, obtained by .
the DND protocol in use, obtained by .
the x position of the pointer in root coordinates.
the y position of the pointer in root coordinates.
the suggested action.
the possible actions.
the timestamp for this operation.
Docs.remarks: This function is called by the drag source.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Abort (Gdk.DragContext context, uint time_);

Docs.param: a
the timestamp for this operation.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Status (Gdk.DragContext context, Gdk.DragAction action, uint time_);

Docs.summary: Selects one of the actions offered by the drag source.
Docs.param: a
the selected action which will be taken when a drop happens, or 0 to indicate that a drop will not be accepted.
the timestamp for this operation.
Docs.remarks: This function is called by the drag destination in response to called by the drag source.

Docs.summary: Returns the selection atom for the current source window.
Docs.param: a

MemberSignature.Value: public static uint GetProtocolForDisplay (Gdk.Display display, uint xid, out Gdk.DragProtocol protocol);

Docs.summary: Finds out the DND protocol supported by a window.
Docs.param: the where the destination window resides.
the X id of the destination window.
location where the supported DND protocol is returned.
Docs.returns: the X id of the window where the drop should happen. This may be xid or the X id of a proxy window, or None if xid doesn't support Drag and Drop.

MemberSignature.Value: public static uint GetProtocol (uint xid, out Gdk.DragProtocol protocol);

Docs.summary: Finds out the DND protocol supported by a window.
Docs.param: the X id of the destination window.
location where the supported DND protocol is returned.
Docs.returns: the X id of the window where the drop should happen. This may be xid or the X id of a proxy window, or None if xid doesn't support Drag and Drop.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void FindWindow (Gdk.DragContext context, Gdk.Window drag_window, int x_root, int y_root, out Gdk.Window dest_window, out Gdk.DragProtocol protocol);

Docs.summary: Finds the destination window and DND protocol to use at the given pointer position.
Docs.param: a
a window which may be at the pointer position, but should be ignored, since it is put up by the drag source as an icon.
the x position of the pointer in root coordinates.
the y position of the pointer in root coordinates.
location to store the destination window in.
location to store the DND protocol in.

remarks.para: This function is called by the drag source to obtain the dest_window and protocol parameters for .

MemberSignature.Value: public static void FindWindowForScreen (Gdk.DragContext context, Gdk.Window drag_window, Gdk.Screen screen, int x_root, int y_root, out Gdk.Window dest_window, out Gdk.DragProtocol protocol);

Docs.summary: Finds the destination window and DND protocol to use at the given pointer position.
Docs.param: a
a window which may be at the pointer position, but should be ignored, since it is put up by the drag source as an icon.
the screen where the destination window is sought.
the x position of the pointer in root coordinates.
the y position of the pointer in root coordinates.
location to store the destination window in.
location to store the DND protocol in.
Docs.remarks: This function is called by the drag source to obtain the dest_window and protocol parameters for .

Docs.param: a
